topics: The Determination of Exchange Rate: World Trade
The Determination of Exchange Rate: The Equilibrium Approach
Parity Conditions in International Finance and Currency Forecasting
Balance of Payments and Economic Linkage
Swaps and Interest Rate Derivatives in the International Finance Markets
International Financing and National Capital Market

grading.policies: No rounding on grades; late submissions lose 10% for each day late.

assignments.description: Case Study due on May 2nd, 2024. Group project involving building a case from scratch.

policies.attendance: Attendance will be taken into consideration in grading.
policies.late_work: Late submissions lose 10% for each day late.
policies.academic_integrity: All students must adhere to the Honor System.
policies.accommodations: Students with special testing needs or disabilities are encouraged to contact the instructor.

additional_info.technology_requirements: Access to Canvas for course materials.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) for mental health support.

instructor.name: Dr. Ying Wu
instructor.office_hours: Friday 2:15 PM - 3:15 PM or by Appointment

_metadata.course_description: The course covers important topics in international financial management, including foreign exchange management.
learning_outcomes: Describe the principle of comparative advantage and absolute advantage.
Describe the international monetary system and a variety of exchange rate systems in the world.
Describe relationships between exchange rates and economic variables.
Identify best practices for measuring and managing exchange rate risk.
Synthesize and evaluate financing options for multinational corporation management.
Gain a practical understanding of factors contributing to foreign exchange rate risks.
